intro: [WRONG START] Stelos vigax, commonly known as the rigid stelis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its upright, grass-like growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces spikes of small, white to pale yellow flowers with a distinct lip. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. Stelis vigax thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil for optimal growth.
